title: A young women in the 1920's that behaved and dressed boldly was referred to as what? - Quora

response.answer_text: A flapper. According to my mother, who was born in 1917, everyone in the twenties wore galoshes, rubber boots that fastened up the front with buckles. If you wanted to be the cat’s pajamas, you left the galoshes unbuckled so they flapped. It was so popular that my mother hurried off to second grade in unbuckled galoshes. But that is why flappers were called flappers. According to mom’s cousin, Dorothy, who was born in 1909, occasionally the buckle from one galosh would connect with the buckle from another galosh, in which case you would fall on your face. The downside to being a flapper.

Why are you posting this sort of question? This is not a seventh grade history test. It’s at least supposed to be a place where people seek knowledge. It’s clear that you already know the answer. How about “An individual who posts insincere questions for which he or she already knows the answer is referred to as what?”
